the topic of this link from its title...

 I find this a very useful and informative site.

I followed your link and I do not understand why are you saying "If you had to guess". Your link is to a site like the Panda's thumb or talk origins that I did not know about, thanks for that but I don't know what this thread is about.

I followed your link and I do not understand why are you saying "If you had to guess". Your link is to a site like the Panda's thumb or talk origins that I did not know about, thanks for that but I don't know what this thread is about.
It's my way of posting a good evolutionist site to the Evolution v Creation forum.
 
 The question merely related to the title of the link. Who would have thought a link with Cape Canaveral in the title would have so much to do with the Creationist/Evolutionist argument? It seemed more interesting than "Hey, here's a good site."

If I guessed on the topic based on what the link says I would have thought it was about NASA or the Space Shuttle not evolution. Interesting. Maybe he had planned something different witht the address when he bought it. Who knows.
My apolgies I thought you were talking about the title at the top of the page "creation science debunked" and not the cape canaveral adress.

You guys didn't look at the first part of the URL - geocities. The site has been around for a long time. It started out offering free sites and I think it still does. You can also get upgraded sites with more disk space at a price. Geocities is now owned by Yahoo. Originally the various geocities domains were divided into "cities" and other locations around the world. Then followed some other designation that divided the location, and then a number, apparently up to 9999. One of the oldest geocities locations is CapeCanaveral and Lenny Flank has been there, debunking creationism, for a decade or more. I think that he is a herpetologist, at least as an amateur.
 
 There is no connection to any U.S. Government installation. You can tell that because nowhere do you see .gov

... I think that he is a herpetologist, at least as an amateur.
